FwkSenCnt.MEANING: a clause that can form a complete sentence on its own

ExCnt.EX: A conjunction joins two main clauses.
E.g: the company whose brand had been copied decided to sue subordinating conjunction a subordinating conjunction is used to join a subordinate clause to a main clause.

A main clause is the clause within a sentence that gives the main sense of the sentence some sentences can have more than one main clause (called a compound sentence ). Grammatically speaking, a clause consists of at least two phrases, a noun phrase which acts as the subject of a finite verb.
